intro: Grabowskia boerhaviifolia var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grabowskia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
